cst235.servicepals.utils

Class DataSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • cst235.servicepals.utils.DataSource

  • public class DataSource
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides all database functionality for the score service web service

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean EXCLUDE_USER_ID 
      static boolean INCLUDE_USER_ID 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataSource()
      Constructor that creates a JDBC connection to the database, creates a Statement object, and, if successful, sets the connected flag to true

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes an open database connection

      • dbGetUserIdFromCredentials

        public int dbGetUserIdFromCredentials(java.lang.String username,
                                      java.lang.String password)
        Retrieves a user in the database by username and password
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user who is attempting to login
        password - the password of the user who is attempting to login
        Returns:
        the user ID if successful, -1 if credentials don't match

      • dbCheckAlreadyExists

        public boolean dbCheckAlreadyExists(java.lang.String nameToCheck,
                                    char nameType)
        Queries either the users or communities table to determine if the name already exists
        Parameters:
        nameToCheck - the user or community name to check
        nameType - a character specifying what table to query: 'U' = users, 'C' = communities
        Returns:
        true if the name already exists; false if not

      • dbCheckUserCommServiceExists

        public boolean dbCheckUserCommServiceExists(int userId,
                                            int communityId,
                                            int serviceId)
        Checks to see if a combination of userId, communityId, and serviceId already exists in the database to prevent a user from offering more than one of the same service to the same community
        Parameters:
        userId - the integer userId of the user offering the service
        communityId - the community into which the user is offering the service
        serviceId - the service code of the offered service
        Returns:
        true if the combination already exists; false if not

      • dbCreateUser

        public int dbCreateUser(java.lang.String firstName,
                        java.lang.String lastName,
                        java.lang.String userName,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        java.lang.String phoneNumber,
                        java.lang.String emailAddress)
        Creates a user in the users table
        Parameters:
        firstName - the user's first name
        lastName - the user's last name
        userName - the user's username
        password - the user's password
        phoneNumber - the user's phone number
        emailAddress - the user's email address
        Returns:
        the user_id of the new user

      • dbCreateCommunity

        public int dbCreateCommunity(java.lang.String commName,
                             java.lang.String accessCode,
                             int adminUserId)
        Creates a new community and writes the (admin user id, community_id) into the user-community table
        Parameters:
        commName - the community name
        accessCode - the community access code
        adminUserId - the user id of the community administrator
        Returns:
        the community_id of the new community if successful; -1 if unsuccessful

      • dbInsertIntoUserCommunity

        public int dbInsertIntoUserCommunity(int userId,
                                     int commId)
        Updates the user-community table with a new user_id, community_id pair
        Parameters:
        userId - the user id
        commId - the community id corresponding to the user
        Returns:
        the auto-generated primary key if successful or -1 if unsuccessful

      • dbRetrieveUserById

        public User dbRetrieveUserById(int userIdToRetrieve)
        Retrieves the user information from the users table with user_id = the passed value
        Parameters:
        userIdToRetrieve - the userId to retrieve from the database
        Returns:
        a User object created from the database information

      • dbRetrieveCommunities

        public java.util.List<Community> dbRetrieveCommunities()
        Retrieves all communities from the database
        Returns:
        a list of Community objects for the user having userId

      • dbRetrieveCommunities

        public java.util.List<Community> dbRetrieveCommunities(int userId,
                                                       boolean includeUserId)
        Overloaded method that retrieves all communities from the database that either includes the userId or excludes the userId
        Parameters:
        userId - the user id to filter on in the query
        includeUserId - includes the userId in the query if true, excludes if false
        Returns:
        a list of Community objects for the user having userId

      • dbRetrieveProvidersByComm

        public java.util.List<ServiceProvider> dbRetrieveProvidersByComm(int communityId)
        Retrieves all service providers by communityId
        Parameters:
        communityId - the communityId to use for querying all providers
        Returns:
        ArrayList of ServiceProvider objects

      • dbGetServiceCategories

        public java.util.List<ServiceProvider> dbGetServiceCategories()
        Retrieves all service ids and service categories from the services table
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of ServiceProvider objects created from the service categories from the databasse

      • dbGetUserIdFromServiceDescriptionAndId

        public int dbGetUserIdFromServiceDescriptionAndId(int serviceId,
                                                  java.lang.String serviceDescription)
        Retrieves the user_id from the user_comm_service table corresponding to the (serviceId, serviceDescription) combination
        Parameters:
        serviceId - the service category identification for the service being requested
        serviceDescription - the description of the service being requested
        Returns:
        the user_id corresponding to a match of both service_id and service_description if successful and -1 if unsuccessful

      • dbGetAvailableTimeSlotsByDate

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> dbGetAvailableTimeSlotsByDate(int providerUserId,
                                                                                       java.lang.String requestedDate)
        Retrieves all time schedule blocks that are not already scheduled by getting all the block_id values that DO NOT have entries in the user_date_block table for the proider's user id on the requested date of service
        Parameters:
        providerUserId - the user_id of the service provider being scheduled
        requestedDate - the requested date of service
        Returns:
        a Map of block-id, scheduleblock pairs representing available time blocks

      • dbCreateUserDateSchedule

        public int dbCreateUserDateSchedule(int providerUserId,
                                    java.lang.String serviceDate,
                                    int blockId)
        Creates a record in the user_date_block table when scheduling a service provider
        Parameters:
        providerUserId - the user id of the service provider
        serviceDate - the date of service being blocked out
        blockId - the id of the time block being reserved
        Returns:
        the auto-generated primary key value for the record

      • dbCreateServiceProvider

        public int dbCreateServiceProvider(int userId,
                                   int communityId,
                                   ServiceProvider p)
        Creates a new service provider
        Parameters:
        userId - the user id of the service provider
        communityId - the id of the community in which the user is providing a service
        p - a ServiceProvider object
        Returns:
        the auto-generated primary key value for the record
